intro: Fedorovia simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved fedorovia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Fedorovia simplicifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands and savannas.
